subsection.name: Description
subsection.p:
Checks the number of record components in the
header
of a record definition.

tr.td: Access modifiers of record definitions where the number of record components should be checked.
Specify the maximum number of components allowed in the header of a record definition.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.source:
public record MyRecord1(int x, int y) { // ok, 2 components ... }
record MyRecord2(int x, int y, String str, Node node, Order order, Data data String location, Date date, Image image) { // violation, 9 components ... }
subsection.p: To configure the check to allow 5 record components at all access modifier levels for record definitions:
To configure the check to allow 10 record components for a public record definition, but 3 for private record definitions:
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="RecordComponentNumber"> <property name="max" value="3"/> <property name="accessModifiers" value="private"/> </module> <module name="RecordComponentNumber"> <property name="max" value="10"/> <property name="accessModifiers" value="public"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
